FuncDef:
The service-ha delay-time command sets the delay time of the value-added service management (VSM) high availability (HA) module.
The undo service-ha delay-time command restores the default delay time of the value-added service management (VSM) high availability (HA) module.
The default delay time of the value-added service management (VSM) high availability (HA) module is 1s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the delay time of service-location backup.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 300, in seconds. The default value is 1.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the delay time of service-location backup, run the service-ha delay-time command. Session entries can be backed up only if the active time of session traffic is longer than the configured delay time of service-location backup.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the display service-ha global-information delay-time command to view the configured delay time of service-location backup.
Precautions
If the configured backup delay is less than 3/16 of the aging time of the sessions, the fast forwarding sessions can be backed up only after 3/16 of the aging time is reached. Non-fast forwarding sessions are not affected.
